thread.title: Former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson believes Danny Dyer is under 'pressure' due to intense filming schedules
thread.title_full: Former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson believes Danny Dyer is under 'pressure' due to intense filming schedules

author: Hayley Minn
title: Former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson believes Danny Dyer is under 'pressure' due to intense filming schedules
text:
Former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson believes Danny Dyer is under 'pressure' due to intense filming schedules The actor played Barry Evans on the BBC soap from 1994 to 2004 Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Shaun Williamson says Danny Dyer is under pressure Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Danny Dyer recently revealed he’s taking a break from EastEnders . 
And Shaun Williamson, who played Barry Evans on the BBC soap from 1994 to 2004, believes it’s due to “pressure” from hectic filming schedules. 
The actor opened up about the long hours the cast constantly put in during filming, while he was on Loose Women today. 
Speaking to panellist Martine McCutcheon, who also previously starred on the soap as Tiffany Butcher around the same time, the pair agreed they’d often be working 17 hour days. 
Asked if he could understand why Danny had decided to take a break recently, Shaun said: “Barry either had a lovely storyline or he didn’t. Read More Shaun spoke out about Danny Dyer's break (Photo: itv) Danny is taking a break from EastEnders (Photo: BBC) Shaun put it down to intense filming schedules (Photo: itv) 
“I’ve seen what can happen to some people who are in all day every day and work all hours. 
“I understand the pressure he’s under and I just hope he can sort it out.” 
It comes after Danny took a leave of absence from EastEnders due to “exhaustion”. 
"Danny is on a short break from EastEnders,” a spokesperson confirmed. 
“This was not enforced by bosses nor has he quit the show." Read More Mick is at the centre of many storylines (Photo: BBC) Shaun said he must be under pressure (Photo: itv) 
His character Mick Carter recently rekindled a possible affair with his daughter-in-law Whitney, played by Shona McGarty. 
He kissed her last year and again last month after Albert Square's horrific bus crash. 
His on-screen wife Linda, played by Kellie Bright, is currently away from Walford, visiting her mum in Spain. 
Meanwhile, off-screen the actress has been on maternity leave, after giving birth to her second child in November last year. 
*Loose Women continues on ITV1 weekdays at 12.30pm Like us on Facebook
